GUI applicationsÂ¶

This is a list of helper applications/scripts that can be used to create or analyze study carrels:

  1. Text editors - BBedit and Notepad++

  2. AntConc - A robust, GUI, cross-platform concordance application; very useful!

  3. folder2metadata - Given a directory, this Python script outputs a CSV file suitable for the Reader

  4. htid2books - Given an access key, secret token, and a HathiTrust identifier, this set of Bash/Perl scripts output plain text as well as PDF versions of a book.

  5. mbox2reader - Given a few configurations, this Python script read an mbox file, and outputs a file system amenable to the Reader

  6. OpenRefine - A wonderful, GUI, cross-platform tool for reading, normalizing, and analyzing tabular data; takes practice but pays off in the end

  7. txt2chapters - Given a plain text file, a pattern, and a directory, this Perl script subdivides the file into chapters saved in the directory

  8. Wordle - No, not the popular word game but instead a GUI application for generating word clouds; found in the Internet Archives Wayback Machine

  9. Topic Modeling Tool

  10. Gephi

Reader Toolbox
